Am I Allowed to Promote OnlyFans on TikTok?

Estimated Reading Time: 3 min 27 sec

There is no direct or precise answer to this question. If you go through the articles on the web answering this question, you will notice that some agree while others decline followed by various reasons. Despite the confusion, this article will give you insight into the cause of the uncertainty and how to overcome it and promote your OnlyFans on TikTok successfully. 

Make an appointment now

Why is it Not Clear Whether You Can Promote OnlyFans on TikTok?

Did you read of the, “TikTok Purge” back in 2020 and 2021? The “TikTok Purge” involved a mass take down of OnlyFans creators’ TikTok accounts. Why? TikTok claimed that the accounts were violating their community guidelines and were driving traffic off TikTok. TikTok does not host NSFW (not safe for work) content as some of it’s audience is under 18 years. TikTok does not have a built-in system to filter what its audience sees. That is why its community rules prohibit “content that commits, promotes, or glorifies sexual solicitation.”

On the other hand, OnlyFans facilitates the selling of NSFW content. According to the statistics available, about 70% of content on OnlyFans is NSFW. Despite some OnlyFans creators producing non-NSFW content, the top earners are usually NSFW content creators. According to a user-generated report by Rolling Stone, the OnlyFans creators affected by the purge said that they did not violate TikTok’s community rules. They say that they posted only PG-rated content (Parental Guidance Suggested) and included a link to their OnlyFans. Some of them used third party linking sites such as Linktree but TikTok banned their accounts. 

An OnlyFans creator making content on TikTok can also lose their account if they use the word OnlyFans within their profile or mention OnlyFans within their videos. Despite this requirement, some OnlyFans still lost their accounts. Lydia Love had this to said this as reported by Rolling Stone, “I wouldn’t even type the word ‘sugar daddy,’ I would type ‘sugar daddi’ and things like that lol. And I never used the word OnlyFans on my page.” TikTok still banned Lydia’s account. Lydia Love added, “TONS of girls I know got deleted. It was like a huge sweep with no explanation.” Lydia lost a TikTok account with about 100,000 followers. This is a huge lose considering the shear effort required to gain followers on TikTok.

 Also, TikTok only allows you to embed a link on your profile after gaining 1000 followers. Rolling Stone requested for a response to the purge from a TikTok representative and he iterated what TikTok’s community rules declare and made it clear that TikTok bans accounts that try to “redirect traffic.” Despite the representative’s claims, TikTok did not ban accounts with links to YouTube and Twitter pages.

Despite TikTok having taken down several OnlyFans creators’ TikTok accounts, it did not take down Bella Thorne’s account. Bella Thorne is an NSFW content creator with a massive following on OnlyFans and TikTok. TikTok did not provide any explanation as to why Bella Thorne’s account was still up on the platform. During the purge, TikTok also took down Rebekka Blue’s TikTok due to her being an OnlyFans creator. Surprisingly, Rebekka had a huge following and TikTok had already granted her the official creator title, meaning she would earn from her videos on the platform. According to Rebekka, she did not show skin nor post any content that would ruin her chances of making more money from her content. Despite her following the rules, TikTok banned her account. 

Rebekka Blue successfully got TikTok to reinstate her account using the legal system. According to her, “Even if you’re not directly promoting yourself, if people see you on TikTok and see oh she’s cute, she has a nice body, or even just for personality or whatever, naturally they might go over to your Instagram and over-time – multiple levels of exposure…”

Rebekka Blue provides more insight by stating that, “The problem is, on TikTok you see so many of these girls under 18 with little to no clothing, but because they’re not making money on their OnlyFans links their content gets to stay up.” This statement indicates the huge controversy surrounding OnlyFans creators promoting their OnlyFans on TikTok. 

OnlyFans has a poor public reputation due to the sheer amount of adult content it hosts. Many people have synonymized OnlyFans with sex. Despite the social view, there is a user base backing OnlyFans and that recommends people to use it. For example, Lee found fame on TikTok and many of her followers requested her to create an OnlyFans. She went from a retail job to earning six figures. 

From the “TikTok purge” to TikTok practicing partiality as to which OnlyFans creator to allow on their platform, it is vivid that there is no clear answer to whether TikTok allows OnlyFans creators to promote themselves on the platform. Despite the ambiguity, as an OnlyFans creator, you must find a way to promote yourself on TikTok because there are so many benefits awaiting you. 

Six Reasons Why You Must Use TikTok to Promote Your OnlyFans Page

  • You Can Go Viral Easily and Gain More Fans 

TikTok is a popular social media platforms with more than one billion users. The platform allows its users to randomly scroll through short videos or search using specific hashtags. Additionally, a user can search for precise TikTok account usernames. TikTok is not like YouTube where users have to search to find specific videos, TikTok’s algorithm recommends videos to its users based on the short videos they watch the most or search. This technique makes it easier for anyone to join the platform and gain subscribers if they post valuable content. 

OnlyFans creators such as Jenna Phillips thank TikTok for their tremendous growth. Jenna had an OnlyFans for about a year and did not find success up until her TikTok post went viral. Jenna mimicked a puppy in her videos doing various things. She made a video lapping water from a bowl and it went viral. The video gained more than a 1,000,000 views.After finding success on TikTok, Jenna shifted her OnlyFans and TikTok content to puppy content. She now makes six figures from her content. Unexpectedly, TikTok banned Jenna’s account after gaining 250,000 followers due to violating community rules. Despite the ban, she created another TikTok account with the username @puppygirljenna and grew her following in the shortest period. 

Lydia Jasminee is another OnlyFans creator who prefers TikTok because she was able to get 100 subscribers in a week despite being new to TikTok. In an interview with The Verge, Jasminee said, “I have to have a TikTok because that’s the most popular social media platform right now. That’s where you’re going to get the most subs.”

TikTok’s main users include teens and kids, but this should not put you off as an OnlyFans creator. Statistics indicate that 59% of TikTok’s users are aged 24 years and above. This data shows you that you have more than 689 million users to market your OnlyFans to and get OnlyFans subscribers. 

  • TikTok Trends Can Fetch You More Fans 

TikTok trends are a great opportunity for you to grow your fanbase. To take full advantage of trends, you should first research to determine the meaning and source of the trend. If the trend is in line with your content, you should jump into the trend quickly to capture as much traffic as you can. 

Anyone can start a trend or a hashtag challenge on TikTok including regular users and brands. The best thing about trends is that, you can adjust the trends outline to fit your content type. For example, the most followed trends include famous voices made by or selected by literally anyone and redistributed. Several random voices go viral on TikTok every day and all you have to do is incorporate the voice in your videos. 

According to a study conducted back in 2020 covering the impact of TikTok on product purchases, 67% of the participants said that TikTok inspired them to purchase products. They also added that, at times they would make impulse purchases without realizing it. The hashtag #TikTokMadeMeBuyIt is a clear indicator that TikTok has a great impact on sales and conversion. 

Since TikTok has a great impact on conversions, as an OnlyFans creator, you must take advantage and start creating content consistently because there are high chances of getting users interested in your OnlyFans content. The 67% of TikTok users confirming that TikTok has a great influence on sales serve as hope that TikTok can get you several fans. Additionally, 73% of the TikTok users that participated in the study said that they connected more with the brands they found on TikTok compared to other social media websites. This finding shows that as an OnlyFans creator, you can have loyal fans by actively promoting yourself on TikTok. 

Since TikTok trends thrive and grow sustained by hashtags, you can observe what hashtags other OnlyFans creators on TikTok whom you share niches with are using. Recording the hashtags and using them to push your content will boost the chances of you getting fans. 

  • Advertising on TikTok is Easier and Budget-Friendly

Using TikTok is straight forward. You only require a great camera phone and to create a TikTok account. You can shoot raw TikTok videos without editing and upload as long as the videos fulfil your objectives and aim. 

TikTok provides you with several features, effects, and sounds. You do not need to use other editing software to come up with concepts, TikTok has inbuilt editing features you can apply to your videos and upload directly on TikTok. Mastering the various features, effects, and sounds saves time and effort when shooting your videos. You can use the dueting feature to attract more fans to your OnlyFans. Dueting allows you to feature alongside the videos of other creators on a split screen setting. You can duet videos of established OnlyFans creators on TikTok to increase content engagement. 

Due to the ease of use and array of features, you can easily start marketing your OnlyFans on TikTok at an affordable price. TikTok also provides you with extra tips and advice on how to develop effective content on their blog. 

  • You Can Collaborate with Other TikTok Creators

TikTok makes it easier to find other OnlyFans creators, to network, and to start pushing your content through collaborations. 

As an OnlyFans creator, you can request another creator who has several followers to duet your video to make your video go viral. If the video successfully goes viral, you can return the favor by dueting one of the creator’s video so that they can also get more followers. This mutual exchange allows the both of you to grow and have more fans. 

If you have the budget, you can pay TikTok influencers who own OnlyFans accounts to promote your content. For example, you can pay an influencer for a mention as they make specific content based on the agreement the two of you have.Paying TikTok influencers to market your content serves as a great future investment because you will continue gaining more followers, unless TikTok deletes the marketing video. 

Other than marketing your OnlyFans through collaborations, you can utilize the chance to expand your brand identity. For example, if you are a fashion model also making OnlyFans content, you can work with TikTok influencers to market your fashion brand in case you start one. 

Branching and creating your own brand becomes more easier due to the network of TikTok influencers you create. You can offer the influencers long term deals and contracts that do not cost you anything while the influencers benefit by getting shares of your brand.

  • TikTok Analytics Boost Your Reach 

The TikTok App is on more than 3 billion phones and about 29% of the phone holders actively use the Application. These numbers indicate that you have an array of potential fans to target and attract. TikTok shows you how many likes, views, and comments your content receives. Likes serve as social proof. The more likes your content receive, the more TikTok’s algorithm recommends your content to new users. 

The comments you receive give you insights into what your audience loves about your content or does not love about it. You can implement changes based on insights you get from your comment section. You can also market your OnlyFans on the comment section once you realize that your audience is interested in your content more. 

By evaluating the ratio of views to likes, you can know which content trends and which one receives more love. Trending content receives more views compared to likes while loved content has more likes and a view count that is close to the number of likes received. 

TikTok business supercharges analytics by allowing you to carry out A/B tests to determine the performance of your content based on a precise region. You can review the number of users who viewed your videos and from which region they hailed from. You also have the liberty to target an audience from a specific region. 

  • Increase Clicks to Your Personal Website

TikTok claims it bans accounts driving traffic off to other websites, but there are several TikTok accounts with links within the bio that TikTok has not taken down. Linking your personal website shields you from the shocks of losing your account because you get to keep your fans and followers. 

If you have a personal website as an OnlyFans creator, you should embed your website’s link on the bio section. You should have a great landing page to capture the traffic you receive from TikTok and ensure that you have a form that collects the details of the users interested in your content. This tactic allows you to keep your fans incase TikTok bans your account. The number of clicks on your website from TikTok will increase gradually once you start getting referrals. TikTok has a user-friendly interface but TikTok limits its users to video content only and some static images posted as videos. This content can be boring at times. Having a website allows you to host varied content such as intriguing videos and images. For every impressed visitor, you are likely to receive referrals for free. 

A personal website allows you to beat TikTok at its game. You can create several websites and direct traffic to them without having to worry about losing your TikTok account because you can always recover your followers by redirecting them from your website to a new TikTok account. Moreover, you can direct traffic from your website to your OnlyFans to earn more. Whenever you are ready, you can expand your brand and start creating different types of content and serving it to your subscribers. 

Make an appointment now

How to Market Your OnlyFans on TikTok Effectively – 3 Best Ways

There is a huge difference between marketing correctly and effectively on TikTok as an OnlyFans creator. Marketing correctly means that there is one single process that applies to almost all OnlyFans creators. On the hand marketing effectively defines a process that is adjustable based on the niche one serves. If you find an article trying to outline a correct way, do not read it because it is a lie. 

TikTok does not entertain accounts that create NSFW content and relies on various content filtering algorithms to take down such content. TikTok also relies on its community to report when a creator posts NSFW content on TikTok. Once TikTok receives a report, it permanently bans the account, or takes down the video and warns the creator. 

Despite the measures put in place by TikTok to curb OnlyFans creators, there are key tactics you can implement to market your OnlyFans. 

Create a thirst-trap profile 

A thirst-trap profile sends a message to the viewer that you are an OnlyFans creator due to how it is set-up. A thirst-trap profile elicits sexual attention or appreciation of the profile owner’s attractiveness. Create a thirst-trap profile by doing the following:

  • Use a username that sends a clear message to your audience that you have an NSFW OnlyFans account. For example, you can include an X in your username because the letter is closely related to NSFW content. 
  • Use a profile picture that shows some skin. For example, you can post a vertical profile pic showing your cleavage. 
  • Have a straightforward call to action within your bio and use the well known OnlyFans percentage tag. For example, “Top 0.1%. Let us chat on Instagram.”

Create content that compliments your thirst-trap profile

As an NSFW OnlyFans content, you should not post revealing content on TikTok such as porn or full nudity pictures. TikTok will take down your content. You should post content that shows less skin but sustains your objective and aim. Post content that does with the following aspects:

  • Put on the right outfit  

Put own clothes that depict your great body shape as an OnlyFan model. Avoid clothes that show your nipples because TikTok might take down the video or ban your account. Avoid clothes that show too much skin. 

  • Post pictures that depict your vibe 

Your dressing says a lot about you. For example, you can dress in a sexually suggestive way but also incorporate a gangster like personality. You should put on clothes that depict your personality and try to incorporate fun in it because this is the main reason many users many consider subscribing to your OnlyFans. 

  • Put on clothes or show items that elicit connections 

If you love a specific movie or song genre, you can create content oriented with the song genre or movie to attract an audience that shares the same likes as yours. The main aim is to create connections with people based on something else other than what you post on OnlyFans. 

Follow these TikTok rules for OnlyFans 

  • Find the best posting time 

Posting consistently on a specific time encourages your audience to come back for more and gives them a schedule they can follower. Play around with varied posting times to know which is the best and when you get more engagement. 

  • Create short videos 

TikTok ranks videos based on the watch time. When users view your videos to the end, TikTok recommends them to other others that is why you should create short videos preferably 10 seconds videos. Short videos also keep the attention of the user compared to long-form videos. 

  • Do not mention OnlyFans in your content 

Avoid mentioning OnlyFans in your content else you risk losing your account. Block the use of the word OnlyFans on within your comment section and do not respond to users who enquire whether you are on OnlyFans. Ignore such comments to avoid losing your account. 

  • Copy Trends 

Trends are the fastest way to grow on TikTok and participating in them lets you know which community likes your content. Experiment with different hashtags and challenges, including popular voice trends to know what works best for you. 

  • Block Trollers

If you make NSFW OnlyFans content and post thirst-trap filled content on TikTok, block all trollers because they might report your account to TikTok. If you create non-NSFW content also block trollers because they might report that you have an embedded link within your bio. 

  • Avoid using Linktree Links 

Linktree links can get your account banned because TikTok associates them with OnlyFans. Use other third-party linking platforms such as short URL. 

  • Use vague or specific hashtags 

 If you create NSFW content, consider using vague hashtags or those close to the message you want to send. On the other hand, if you post non-NSFW content, use specific hashtags to attract specific users to your account. 

What to Do Once TikTok Bans Your Account 

If TikTok bans your account, you should appeal through their help center to have it reinstated. If you can afford it, use the legal system to get it back. You can also seek the services of a great agency such as Fandafia to direct you on how to get your account back. 

Conclusion

TikTok does not have a clear stand as to whether it allows OnlyFans creators on their platform to market themselves. If you are an OnlyFans creator finding it hard to sell on TikTok, this article should solve your problems. 

For more guidance and help with marketing on TikTok as an OnlyFans creator, reach out to Fandafia. It all starts with an appointment. Book your appointment today.
